intro: Windmannia lachnocarpa, commonly known as the sticky windmannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Windmannia lachnocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
